full_text: These guys are phenomenal - #Ireland https://t.co/TYuGOv2U6w
Welcome strong language from @vonderleyen - EUCO will be important. https://t.co/huNDlLLLU9

It is utterly unacceptable. This is an Irish Airline with EU citizens on board, forced to land in Minsk, while travelling between EU cities. A strong an united response from EU needed.  EU inaction or indecision will be taken as weakness by Belarus. @dfatirl https://t.co/WUwdcsTjSU

Delighted to get 1st dose vaccine today at #CorkCityHall - the team there are doing a fantastic job, couldn’t have been more professional or friendlier. Great job @HSELive @defenceforces @corkcitycouncil - keep it up, we’re getting there!! #COVID19 https://t.co/Pdte77lfVj
Extremely worrying reports of a Ryanair plane forced to land in Belarus to detain an opposition blogger. We are in contact with the Airline and EU colleagues.  https://t.co/1zmsryjEKl
French visit a chance to cement ties with our new nearest EU neighbour https://t.co/5lwAhojK6t

Ceasefire is welcome. This is a delicate moment and we await definitive confirmation and implementation. The immediate focus must now be on getting vital humanitarian assistance to those who need it. ⁦@dfatirl⁩ ⁦@irishmissionun⁩  https://t.co/w48qS065Gr
Aujourd'hui, nous accueillerons @JY_LeDrian  et ⁦@CBeaune⁩ en Irlande.  Voisins proches, bons amis toujours. ⁦@dfatirl⁩ ⁦@francediplo⁩ https://t.co/oiVeM27Lb4
Progress made on Iran Nuclear Deal negotiations. ⁦@irishmissionun⁩ ⁦@dfatirl⁩  https://t.co/v60u4KJpT0
⁦@HSELive⁩ #Covid19 #staysafe https://t.co/dy2vuQJ7E2
US Senate voices support for Good Friday Agreement via @RTENews https://t.co/pZSkpYWoVW
Congratulations @BeattieDoug on taking on the leadership of the @uuponline - I look forward to working with you. Good luck with the job! @dfatirl https://t.co/yxwz0kOsUq
On #IDAHOT2021, Ireland reaffirms its commitment to fighting discrimination and upholding the rights of the LGBTI+ community. @HumanRightsIRL
Interesting and thoughtful contribution @irishmissionun @dfatirl https://t.co/cEg3Yvo30T
This cannot be acceptable to the International Community. #UNSecurityCouncil needs to speak with one voice to hold those responsible to account. @irishmissionun https://t.co/V6FyCYCXx7
@RndnTwit I have repeatedly condemned Hamas for firing rockets into Israel. Both sides need to be held to account by international community.

32 children killed since Monday in #Gaza by Israeli fire - that’s approx 1/4 of all fatalities - It’s not acceptable! Israel has int. legal obligation to protect children in conflict & r not doing so! #Ireland will speak forcefully again at UNSC tomorrow.  https://t.co/HGiCoTbfwk
My condolences to the family and friends of Tim Falvey. He’ll be missed and remembered by so many across #Cork. https://t.co/MPM2qd1M2P
@paulreiddublin @HSELive You’re doing a heroic job Paul, keep it up. @HSELive @paulreiddublin
Congratulations to @edwinpootsmla - I wish him well as new DUP leader & look forward to engaging & working with him and @paulabradleymla on shared challenges and mutual benefit N/S. @dfatirl
@TomClonan Congratulations and best of luck for the future Eoghan. You’re a very impressive young man!

Protection of civilians, particularly children, is of paramount importance. IHL must be respected. Thanks to humanitarian community who continue to deliver under these conditions. Now is the time for strong political engagement. We must act now.  @irishmissionun #SecurityCouncil

The #SecurityCouncil must speak on this issue and condemn violence against civilians by all parties and call for an immediate ceasefire. People of the Gaza Strip cannot endure another war. Rockets from Gaza into Israel must stop.

Ireland is at UN #SecurityCouncil now having called for an emergency meeting on escalating violence in the occupied Palestinian territory and Israel. Thoughts are with Palestinians and Israelis who bear the brunt of this. Civilians on both sides deserve better.
US software firm opens new Cork centre creating 35 jobs https://t.co/4PUvsufzov

Ireland worked with other like minded countries last night to insist on an emergency UN Security Council session today (2pm Irish time) as Israel-Hamas violence escalates. Increasing numbers of civilians are being killed and injured. We need ceasefire now. https://t.co/a3U8oYtIfc
Coveney: 'New light' cast on 'dark page' of conflict via @RTENews https://t.co/BnsBS2f91B
Absolutely, this cycle of violence must end. #Ireland will continue to raise concerns in @UN Security Council. @irishmissionun https://t.co/42FEEzeV05

I’ve been in @UNRWA schools in #Gaza. Killing of children in conflict is never acceptable. Israel should be condemned for targeting Gaza with such tragic consequences.  Firing rockets from Gaza must be condemned, but so too should such a brutal response. This violence must end. https://t.co/qDMj4QjiRI

Thoughts are with Ballymurphy families, who lost loved ones nearly 50 yrs ago in some of the most tragic days of the troubles. Like all victims in NI, they have the right to truth & justice, even decades later. I hope the inquest will provide some answers. https://t.co/Fj9wyzaUPO

I wish ⁦@SteveAikenUUP⁩ well as he steps down as ⁦⁦⁦@uuponline⁩ leader - we haven’t always agreed, but Steve contributed significantly to getting Stormont working again. He will continue to play an important roll in NI politics. ⁦@dfatirl⁩ https://t.co/yHu3amVWft

Rockets are never the answer! I condemn the firing of rockets into Israel.  What’s needed is strong engagement by the Int. community with Israeli & Palestinian Authorities, with int. law & agreed UN resolutions as the basis. ⁦@irishmissionun⁩  https://t.co/F98A1wD8BH

Evictions & threatened evictions in Sheikh Jarrah & Silwan, & the brutal response of Israeli security services to protests in Al Aqsa compound, is unacceptable. The right to peaceful freedom of assembly is non-negotiable. Violence & incitement must end.  https://t.co/mZ9OiPtmTM

Deeply shocked & saddened by terrorist attack targeting girls leaving a school in Kabul. My thoughts & deepest sympathies are with  victims, their families & the Afghan people. I wish a speedy recovery to those injured. This horrendous violence must end. https://t.co/ZHZOsr3dLS
As a father of 3 daughters, who happen to love sport & horses, @rachaelblackmor is such an inspiration #nolimits https://t.co/ckIKDUOeQC

Death penalty is not the answer to delivery of justice & maintenance of the rule of law, in any country. #Ireland has been consistent in calling for an end to use of the death penalty & and will continue to do so. ⁦@irishmissionun⁩ ⁦@dfatirl⁩  https://t.co/N5mb5saBYK

V concerned by violence in E Jerusalem & threatened evictions in Sheikh Jarrah. Evictions & demolitions should cease. I urge Israel to reverse its decision on construction in Har Homa – settlements are illegal under int. law & undermine prospects for peace & TSS. @irishmissionun

I’ve met many victims of the Troubles & their families. I’ve seen ongoing heartbreak & pain whenever legacy is in news. Irish Govt is clear that we oppose any unilateral action on legacy, contrary to SHA. Victims&NI must be the priority, the only priority! https://t.co/sra1KACinD

This is a very significant announcement by @AmbassadorTai and #USA - it won’t solve all #Covid vaccine manufacturing & supply issues, but it is a big step & the right decision in response to a global demand emergency. @dfatirl https://t.co/o3R86V7LDf
A helpful guide to the “step by step” easing of #Covid19 restrictions decided by Govt. #staysafe https://t.co/hfTWBkTo6r

Sincere condolences and sympathy to all Israeli people on such a tragic event. You are in our thoughts and prayers at a time of extraordinary loss. @dfatirl @EmbassyTLV @EUinIsrael https://t.co/pQuXwfFUl2
New direct Cork to Antwerp freight service as shippers continue to avoid UK landbridge. ⁦@PortofCork⁩  https://t.co/9oA9xooU0C
‘A good news day’ - congratulations to ⁦@HMcEntee⁩ and Paul on the birth of a baby boy.  https://t.co/6dXU38kaZe
Congratulations @SamanthaJPower - @USAID is more important than ever for so many! @dfatirl @irishmissionun https://t.co/rcH326ROxh

Best wishes to @dupleader Arlene Foster & her family this evening. While we bring different perspectives to some issues, she has worked sincerely, tirelessly & with determination for her party & for NI as First Minister.

I’ve been informed a court in Lebanon has rejected an appeal by Mahmoud Bazzi for the murders of Irish soldiers Derek Smallhorne & Thomas Barrett in 1980. My thoughts are with Smallhorne & Barrett families, Defence Forces & my Department who fought for justice. @defenceforces
Important info for parents and families in #carrigaline @Carrigdhounnews https://t.co/bg8gYiXpdH
Now there’s a sight I haven’t seen for too long!  - back for training with a smile tonight 😃 #staysafe https://t.co/2Zr3mPm1An
@HHumphreysFG is really delivering for Rural Ireland in govt - so much investment and ambition. @FineGael #OurRuralFuture https://t.co/D4Y8VAYE8A
Completely agree. Look forward to supporting new initiative in this area. Well done @HMcEntee https://t.co/Zv6NsOfYqY
Happy St George’s Day to all our English friends. ⁦@dfatirl⁩ https://t.co/KfmExh5wbY
Fantastic achievement by @UCC - well done and well deserved. Great university, getting better all the time! #UNSDGs https://t.co/CBLc5jPZ8L

I’ve known ⁦@EamonRyan⁩ for 20yrs. He’s been a tireless campaigner for #ClimateAction. Introducing such an ambitious Climate Action Bill was the achievement of a life’s work. This Bill changes #Ireland for the better, for decades! @greenparty_ie⁩  https://t.co/nMN1r0aPXJ
Congratulations to @maria16byrne on her election today to Seanad Éireann. https://t.co/5bdXY3xtvu

I completely condemn this despicable attack on a police officer near Dungiven. Our thoughts. solidarity & support go to her, her family & her PSNI colleagues.  Anyone with information should assist with PSNI investigation.  https://t.co/XuJL1yIOpt
@IanMoranWex @yfg Thanks Ian. Look forward to working with you @FineGael @yfg
'The navy is my family': Irish Defence Forces welcomes first Rastafarian recruit ⁦@defenceforces⁩ ⁦@naval_service⁩  https://t.co/bUu7xUjAvR

New Special Needs School in Carrigaline with capacity for 48 places. Dept will consult to identify a patron shortly. New school will be located in the existing Gaelscoil building, to be refurbished over summer for 2021/22 school year. Great news for parents and families. https://t.co/j6P7e44cX9
Good initiative, great opportunities in outdoor water activities - 🐳 https://t.co/KS0RFwKyWu

Busy couple of days in London. Good to meet my counterpart @DominicRaab to discuss the @UN Security Council and the shared work of Ireland and U.K. 🇮🇪🇺🇳🇬🇧 @dfatirl @irishmissionun @FCDOGovUK https://t.co/GOJH2tx6py

What a win, what a season @rachaelblackmor is having. Such a sporting inspiration. https://t.co/Dx2UbT2wy7

Remember today, 23 yrs ago when people & parties of very different backgrounds & perspectives had the courage to take a risk, to change the course of history, to shape a future for the better. It’s an inspiration that can help us resolve today’s challenges too. 🇮🇪🇬🇧🇪🇺🇺🇸 https://t.co/WPcwje57HX
